abstract: For the third consecutive week, CBS’s Thursday night line-up earned more viewers than any of its network competitors during every time slot of the night. Beginning with the second to last installment of “Survivor: Micronesia,” CBS drew 12.7 million viewers to lead the 8 p.m. hour, according to Nielsen’s estimates. CBS then dominated the rest of the night with “CSI” at 9 p.m. (17.8 million) and “Without a Trace” at 10 p.m. (14.6 million).
lead_paragraph: For the third consecutive week, CBS’s Thursday night line-up earned more viewers than any of its network competitors during every time slot of the night. Beginning with the second to last installment of “Survivor: Micronesia,” CBS drew 12.7 million viewers to lead the 8 p.m. hour, according to Nielsen’s estimates. CBS then dominated the rest of the night with “CSI” at 9 p.m. (17.8 million) and “Without a Trace” at 10 p.m. (14.6 million).

headline.main: Ratings: If It’s Thursday, It Must Be CBS
